document_data.name: Mount of Forgiveness
document_data.mainbody: The '''Mount of Forgiveness''' was a necropolis located in [[Muluk]], the City of Kings, in [[1367 DR]].{{AQ-time}}
document_data.Description: Located just outside of the walls on the southeast side of the city, this artificial mount was covered with artistic tombs and sepulchers.
document_data.Activities: The Mount of Forgiveness was the resting place for the honored dead of Muluk, including past caliphs and royal families.
document_data.Rumors & Legends: The citizens of Muluk whispered that the [[undead]] of the Mount of Forgiveness tunneled out a maze of catacombs within the earth. The clergy of Muluk's mosques insisted this was a simple lie instigated by jealous rivals of the city.
